law.catch_line: The Commission consists of 7 members, appointed by the Governor with the advice of the Secretary....

section.section: The Commission consists of 7 members, appointed by the Governor with the advice of the Secretary.

Of the 7 members of the Commission:
3 shall have experience in some phase of the business of home improvement;
at least 1 shall have experience in the business of banking or finance; and
3 shall be consumer members.

text.section: Each member of the Commission shall have been a citizen and resident of the State for at least 5 years before appointment.

While a member of the Commission, a consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Commission; or
grade any examination given by or for the Commission.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Commission shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms in effect for members of the Commission on October 1, 1992.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
